results.title: A Child's place
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
Looks at the system of daycare for young children in Israel, USSR, China and Sweden.The film asks “Where are the children? Who are they with? and what are they doing?”.

results.title: A Child's Christmas in Wales by Dylan Thomas
results.brief_description: Using still photographs, this film shows life in Wales, illustrating Dylan Thomas’s recorded reading of his reminiscences about Christmas in his home country. Children play tricks on their elders, the adults enjoy the food and drink and even the local fire brigade becomes involved.

results.title: Children's world of travel
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Shin Riken Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Children have many dreams and there is a common dream the whole world over - travel. In this film, the dreams of Japanese children come true - in the realm of modern Japanese transport, with examples of the fast gleaming monorail, cable cars and other unusual systems in use in Japan today.

results.title: Children's Theatre
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, John Morris, Lilias Fraser and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Children at the Studio Theatre in Adelaide study painting, music and speech as part of their training in ballet. This is a Children’s Theatre for children and by children. Classes and rehearsals, planning and teaching precede the performance of an Australian ballet, telling the story of an Australian aboriginal legend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall, John Morris, Lilias Fraser and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Children's Story Telling Caravan Bus
results.creator_credit: Hakuho Foundation for the Advancement of Children's Education
results.brief_description: One of the major activities of the Hakuho Foundation is the Children’s Storytelling Caravan Bus. The Caravan Bus travels to places where children gather, to provide a collection of books to children who are beginning to read. Co-operation exists among the caravan bus staff, made up of the storytellers, the rhythm game leaders, the artists who create the pictures and music and writers who provide the stories and rading matter. Special emphasis is also placed on travelling to those areas where the mothers do not recognise the importance of reading to children and thus not only providing enjoyment to the children but also influencing the mothers through these children. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Children's songs of Japan
results.creator_credit: Sotoji Kimura and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Children are much the same the whole world over - but the songs sung by the children of Japan are traditional and distinctive. Many are associated with the seasons and historical events while others are the simple type of songs associated with childhood adventures and fairy tale characters, but all have a truly Japanese character.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sotoji Kimura and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs

results.title: Children's play centres
results.creator_credit: National Fitness Council of Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: During the Christmas holidays many Melbourne children are entertained and cared for at play centres, established by local authorities in association with the National Fitness Council. Short sequences show the youngsters taking part in various games under the guidance of trained leaders.

results.title: Children's play
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Play is a dynamic factor in a child’s development as well as a requirement for good health. This film points out the changing form of children’s recreations, portraying play at each age level. The film demonstrates the important contributions parents can and should make to give their children the best possible chance for healthy play.

results.title: Children's language in early reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Samples some of the early reading activities in two primary schools in Britain. These activities include use of word cards, sentence construction and reading of printed texts and children’s own stories.

results.title: The Children's fountain
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie, U.S. Committee for UNICEF and United Nations
results.brief_description: Shows the programs of the Turkish Government to improve the health and welfare of their children. These programs are aided by UNICEF and other UN agencies. They are seen through the eyes of a young nurse, who takes additional special training and becomes part of a pilot project for rural nursing.
